title: Thus endeth the doctrinal of sapyence the whyche is ryght vtile and prouffytable to alle crysten men, whyche is translated out of Frenshe in to englysshe by wyllyam Caxton at westmestter [sic] fynysshed the. vij. day of may the yere of our lord, M,cccc lxxx ix Caxton me fieri fecit
author: Roye, Gui de, ca. 1345-1409.
notes: A translation of: Roye, Gui de.  Le doctrinal de sapience.
Text, A1r, begins: T³his that is writen in this lytyl boke ought the prestres to lerne and teche to theyr parysshēs ..
Secundo folio: Of sorceryes and deuynacyons capitulo ij ..
Variant: with three final leaves containing an additional chapter, "Of the necligences happyng in the masse. and of the remedyes".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
